subject: Investing
title: What Happens When You Place a Trade
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Happens When You Place a Trade usable.

hook.text: You tap 'buy 10 shares of Google.' Behind the scenes, a 12-step chain fires in under one second.

buildup.text: Your broker sends the order to a matching engine. It finds a seller willing to trade at your price.

discovery.text: The trade settles in T+1 â€” one business day. Until then, the shares technically aren't yours yet.

twist.text: Your broker may route the order to a market maker instead of the exchange. This is called payment for order flow.

climax.text: Clearing houses guarantee both sides honor the trade. They are the invisible safety net of every market.

punchline.text: One click, twelve steps, one second. The plumbing is invisible but essential.

quiz.question: How long does it take for a US stock trade to settle?
